Class Expense

java.lang.Object
Classes.Expense
public class Expense extends Object
This class is responsible for managing user expenses including creating, displaying, updating, and deleting expense records in a database.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Expense(User user, Connection c)
    Constructs an Expense object with a specified User and database connection.

  • Constructor Details

    • Expense

      public Expense(User user, Connection c)
      Constructs an Expense object with a specified User and database connection. Initializes a Scanner instance and sets up the "expenses" table in the database.
      Parameters:
      user - An object representing the currently logged-in user.
      c - The Connection object used to interact with the database.

  • Method Details

    • menu

      public void menu()
      Displays a menu to the user for managing expenses and performs actions based on user input.

      The menu options include: 1. Adding a new expense. 2. Editing an existing expense by ID. 3. Deleting an expense by ID. 4. Displaying all expenses.

    • add_expense

      public void add_expense()
      Adds a new expense to the database.

      This method prompts the user to input details for a new expense including: expense ID, amount, category, date, and whether the expense is recurring. It validates each input to ensure that it is valid before inserting the expense into the database.

      Behavior and Input Validation: - Prompts the user to enter a unique expense ID and checks if the ID already exists in the database. - Ensures the expense amount is not empty or less than are equal to zero. - Ensures the category is not empty. - Validates the date format to ensure it complies with the 'yyyy-mm-dd' format. - Asks the user whether the expense is recurring and stores the response accordingly.

    • edit_expensesTable

      public void edit_expensesTable(String id)
      Edits the expense in the "expenses" table for a specific expense ID. Allows the user to update either the category, the amount, or both.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the expense entry to be edited.

    • edit_category

      public void edit_category(String id)
      Edits the category of an expense by changing it in the database. Prompts the user to input a new category for the specified expense id. The update operation will only succeed if the entered category is valid.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the expense whose category is to be edited.

    • edit_amount

      public void edit_amount(String id)
      Edits the amount of an expense in the database associated with the given expense id. The method retrieves the current expense amount, prompts the user to input a new amount, and updates the expense record if a valid new amount is provided.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the expense to be updated

    • validate_id

      public boolean validate_id(String id)
      Validates whether the given expense id exists in the database and if it is associated with the current user's email.
      Parameters:
      id - the expense ID to validate
      Returns:
      true if the ID is valid and belongs to the current user, false otherwise

    • display_expenses

      public void display_expenses()
      Retrieves and displays all expense records associated with the user's email from the expenses table. Each expense record includes its id, category, and amount, which are displayed to the user.

    • delete_expense

      public void delete_expense(String id)
      Deletes an expense entry from the database based on the provided expense ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the expense to be deleted from the database.
